meanings.definition: The state of not being available.
meanings.sent1: The nonavailability of the book at the library disappointed the students.
meanings.sent2: The nonavailability of parking spaces made it difficult to find a spot.
meanings.sent3: The nonavailability of ice cream on a hot day was a cruel joke.
meanings.sent4: Her nonavailability during the crisis left us feeling lost.
meanings.sent5: The nonavailability of water in the desert was life-threatening.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of not being accessible or obtainable.
meanings.sent1: The nonavailability of the medicine caused concern among the patients.
meanings.sent2: The nonavailability of the product led to a decrease in sales.
meanings.sent3: His nonavailability for the meeting raised suspicions among his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The nonavailability of time seemed to be a constant struggle.
meanings.sent5: The nonavailability of internet connection disrupted the work flow.
